sentences.en: An Olympic gold medal can lead to untold riches for an athlete.
sentences.cn: 一枚奥运金牌能给运动员带来无尽的财富。

sentences.en: Chemical seepage has caused untold damage.
sentences.cn: 化学品泄漏已造成不可估量的损失。

sentences.en: Her secret remains untold to this day.
sentences.cn: 她的秘密至今仍未透露.
她的经历至今未对外介绍过.

sentences.en: In such quantities, these chemical agents could also kill untold thousands.
sentences.cn: 数量如此之大的化学毒气能把成千上万人置于死地.

sentences.en: She has done untold damage to our chances.
sentences.cn: 她给我们的机遇造成了不可估量的损害.

sentences.en: The demise of the industry has caused untold misery to thousands of hard-working tradesmen.
sentences.cn: 该行业的没落给数以千计辛苦经营的商贩带来了难言的苦楚。

sentences.en: The rumours will do untold damage to his reputation.
sentences.cn: 这些谣言会给他的名声造成无法估计的损害。

sentences.en: Their lives were filled with untold suffering.
sentences.cn: 他们生活在水深火热之中.

sentences.en: These gases cause untold damage to the environment.
sentences.cn: 这些气体对环境造成难以估计的破坏。

sentences.en: They encountered untold difficulties and dangers before they reached their destination.
sentences.cn: 他们经历过数不尽的艰难险阻才到达目的地.

sentences.en: They suffered untold terrors in the dark and huddled together for comfort.
sentences.cn: 他们遭受着黑暗中的难以言传的种种恐怖,因而只好挤在一堆互相壮胆.

sentences.en: This age-old struggle for control had led to untold bloody wars.
sentences.cn: 这场由来已久的对控制权的争夺已经引发了无数流血的战争。

sentences.en: This might do untold damage to her health.
sentences.cn: 这也许会给她的健康带来难以估量的伤害。

sentences.en: This phobia can cause untold misery for the sufferer.
sentences.cn: 这种恐惧能给患者造成极度的痛苦.

sentences.en: What is there to fear even if untold hardships lie ahead?

words.tran_cn: 数不清的；未说过的；未透露的；无限的

trans.tran_cn: 未说过的，未透露的，说不尽的，未叙述的，没有说到的
